trepr package¶

trepr.averaging module¶

Averaging.

When measuring trepr, the resulting spectrum is always two dimensional. To analyse the data it’s necessary to extract a one dimensional spectrum. The one dimensional spectrum can either be a cut along the field- or the timeaxis. To get a representative spectrum, the average over several measurementpoints is calculatet.

This module calculates the average in a given range along a given axis.

class trepr.averaging.Averaging(dimension=0, avg_range=None, unit='axis')[source]¶

Bases: aspecd.processing.ProcessingStep

Averaging of a given dataset along one of its two dimensions.

Parameters:
  • dimension (0,1) – Dimension along the averaging is done. 0 is along the fieldaxis and 1 is along the timeaxis. Default is 0.
  • average_range (list) – Range in which the averaging will take place.
  • unit ('axis', 'index') – Unit in which the average range is given. Either ‘axis’ for axisvalues or ‘index’ for indices. Default is axis.
parameters¶

All Parameters that must be known to reproduce the averaging.

Type:dict
description¶

Describes the aim of the class.

Type:str
undoable¶

Information weather the processing step is undoable or not.

Type:bool

trepr.coloring module¶

To make a 2D plot meaningful, it needs significant colors.

This module makes sure that the zero point of the colormap is equal to the zero point of the dataset.

class trepr.coloring.Coloring(dataset=<trepr.dataset.Dataset object>)[source]¶

Bases: object

Set the colormap zero point equal to the dataset zero point.

Parameters:dataset (object) – object of the dataset class.

trepr.dataset module¶

To produce replicable results it’s important not to change the raw data.

This module creates a dataset structure, inheriting from the aspecd dataset class.

class trepr.dataset.Dataset[source]¶

Bases: aspecd.dataset.Dataset

trepr.importer module¶

Trepr raw data consists of multiple timetraces, each stored in a text file. To analyze the raw data, it’s necessary to bring the timetraces all together in form which can be stored as one dataset.

This module imports raw data, defines the axis and hands all over to a dataset.

class trepr.importer.Importer(path='')[source]¶

Bases: aspecd.importer.Importer

Import a dataset including its metadata.

Parameters:path (str) – Path to the dataset.
dataset¶

Object of the dataset class.

Type:object

trepr.plotter module¶

To analyze a trepr spectrum it’s helpful to plot the dataset either in a 2D or a 1D plot.

This module creates either a 2D or 1D plot of a given dataset.

trepr.pretrigger_offset_compensation module¶

One of the first processing steps after measuring trepr is to set the average of the pretrigger timetrace to zero. The so called pretrigger offset compensation.

This module makes a pretrigger offset compensation on a given dataset.

class trepr.pretrigger_offset_compensation.PretriggerOffsetCompensation[source]¶

Bases: aspecd.processing.ProcessingStep
